channel.title: Ranks and how to obtain them?
channel.description: How do you earn different things like first time poster and all that stuff

item.title: Ranks and how to obtain them?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

TabbyKiller:

You be a good boy and get lots of cookies aka enough rep

I may have a lot of Cookies, but not as much rep as some people on this forum. Moderators such as Archer, KO9 and I do not have 200rep yet we are Moderators. As Chassy13 said, its about how much effort and thought is put into your posts and keeping high standards (consistency). But, as Lothy once said, if you magically change from bad to good overnight, the staff will know. It is nothing to do with rep

Read full topic
item.source: Ranks and how to obtain them?

item.source: Ranks and how to obtain them?

item.title: Ranks and how to obtain them?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“Bow To Me, post:11, topic:294840”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=389924.msg2912635#msg2912635 date=1250197410]

Senior is only 100?

If you’re asking about Moderator positions and titles such as Java Guru, then those are chosen by the staff. (Maybe some other people for smaller spots).

Edit:

what about being a MoparScape Moderator? How do u get that?

A moderator is chosen by attitude and activity. I do not mean activity as in total time logged in, I mean how much work they put into these forums. A member is usually never chosen if they ask for moderator, as this makes us think they only want power. We go through a decent sized(for most) procedure while choosing moderators in a thread.

A MoparScape Vet is chosen by staff and other vets. A 2:1 ration in yes:no votes must take place. If most of us think the member is capable, they will receive the spot. Members are nominated by staff and other vets aswell. Usually nobody is nominated unless they did something that gets quite a bit of attention from another Vet or a moderator.

I hope this pretty much sums it up for you

No:Yes+1 for vet.

2:1 + 1 yes
[/quote]
1 No : 2 Yes (+ 1 yes).[/quote]

that’s what I meant

Read full topic
item.source: Ranks and how to obtain them?

@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“time of rune, post:2, topic:294840”]The more posts you gain, the higher your rank.

This is in the wrong section though. This section is for Server Help.[/quote]
This is the Right Section its in General Questions and a Question about This Fourms Ranks is not Server Related

Read full topic

I hope this pretty much sums it up for you

A moderator is chosen by attitude and activity. I do not mean activity as in total time logged in, I mean how much work they put into these forums. @chassy13 wrote:

Senior is only 100?

If you’re asking about Moderator positions and titles such as Java Guru, then those are chosen by the staff. (Maybe some other people for smaller spots).

Edit:

r0ckstar96:

what about being a MoparScape Moderator? How do u get that?

A moderator is chosen by attitude and activity. I do not mean activity as in total time logged in, I mean how much work they put into these forums. A member is usually never chosen if they ask for moderator, as this makes us think they only want power. We go through a decent sized(for most) procedure while choosing moderators in a thread.

A MoparScape Vet is chosen by staff and other vets. A 2:1 ration in yes:no votes must take place. If most of us think the member is capable, they will receive the spot. Members are nominated by staff and other vets aswell. Usually nobody is nominated unless they did something that gets quite a bit of attention from another Vet or a moderator.

I hope this pretty much sums it up for you
